SUBTITLE.PENDING_TITLE: A total of {{param}} Pending Txns found

MORE.BROADCAST_TIP_0: This page allows you to paste a Signed Raw Transaction in hex format (i.e. characters 0-9, a-f) and broadcast it over the Ethereum network.
MORE.VERIFY_TITLE: Verify and Publish your Solidity Source Code
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_1: Step 1 : Enter your Contract Source Code below.
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_2: Step 2 : If the Bytecode generated matches the existing Creation Address Bytecode, the contract is then Verified.
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_3: Step 3 : Contract Source Code is published online and publicably verifiable by anyone.
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_NOTES_1: 1. To verify Contracts that accept Constructor arguments, please enter the ABI-encoded Arguments in the last box below.
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_NOTES_2: 2. For debugging purposes if it compiles correctly at Browser Solidity, it should also compile correctly here.
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_NOTES_3: 3. Contracts that use "imports" will need to have the code concatenated into one file as we do not support "imports" in separate files. You can try using the Blockcat solidity-flattener or SolidityFlattery
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_NOTES_4: 4. We do not support contract verification for contracts created by another contract
MORE.VERIFY_STEP_NOTES_5: 5. There is a timeout of up to 45 seconds for each contract compiled. If your contract takes longer than this we will not be able to verify it.
MORE.ENTER_CONTRACT: Enter the Solidity Contract Code below
MORE.PARAMS_TIP: The following are optional Parameters which you might need to provide depending your contract
MORE.CONSTRUCTOR_ARGUMENT_1: Constructor Arguments ABI-encoded (For contracts that accept constructor parameters)
MORE.CONSTRUCTOR_ARGUMENT_2: Fetch From Gist For additional information on Constructor Arguments see Our KB Entry
MORE.LIBRARY_ADDRESS_TIP: Contract Library Address (For contracts that use libraries, supports up to 5 libraries)
